content: the harvester hat by stephanie herz materials approximately 100 yards of a bulky weight yarn i used charisma by loops & threads 8mm 16inch circular needles 9mm 16 inch circular needles 8 or 9 mm double pointed needles mostly just used for the last row large blunt sewing needle to weave in ends i prefer to use a 16-inch circular for the hat body and then switch to double pointed needles for the decreases of course you can use one long circular for magic loop method if that s your jam abbreviations pm - place marker k1 -knit one p1 - purl one round - round sts - stitches c1r move 2 sts to cable needle and hold in back of work knit 1 knit 2 from cable needle c1l move 1 sts to cable needle and hold in front of work knit 2 knit 1 from cable needle k2tog - knit two together s1p - slip one purlwise sts - stitches pattern using 8mm circular needle cast on 52 sts using the long tail cast on method pm and join in the round work 3 in p1 k1 rib switch to 9mm needles and proceed pattern as follows round 1 *k2 s1p k1* repeat around round 2 same as round 1 round 3 *c1r k1* repeat around round 4 knit around round 5-6 repeat round 1 round 7 k2 *c1l knit 1* repeat * to last 2 stitches place next stitch on cable needle knit last stitch remove round marker knit first stitch replace marker and knit stitch from cable needle this is the new first stitch of the round round 8 knit around repeat rounds 1-8 twice more decreasing round 1 k2 k2tog around 39 sts round 2 knit around round 3 k1 k2tog around 26 sts round 4 k2tog around 13 sts cut yarn leaving about a 10 tail using a large sewing needle weave end through the remaining 13 sts draw together and push end through the center between the stitches weave in ends i prefer to add a furry pompom to make this hat extra fun
